definition: to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
lit. to stare at the ceiling while writing a book (idiom); to put one's whole body and soul into a book

sentences.english: Nanjing had one book published by the whole "Kai Li line synchronous training 1000 cases".
sentences.chinese: 宁一全曾著书出版《楷隶行同步练千例》。

sentences.english: Writing books is a form signifying the establishment of a scholar's own theoretical system.
sentences.chinese: 著书立说是学者们形成自己理论体系的一个表现形式。

sentences.english: Finally the Ambassador quoted Lord Patten of Barnes in his book entitled What Next?
sentences.chinese: 最后，刘大使引用彭定康校长的著书《下步如何？

sentences.english: What's more, wrote books to advocate the western culture.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他还著书立说，积极宣扬西方文化。

sentences.english: It was probably the highest honorarium ever received by an author for writing a book.
sentences.chinese: 可能是史上，一介作者著书所获的最大报酬。

sentences.english: Publications include over 50 papers and 3 books and 3 software copyrights.
sentences.chinese: 发表论文50多篇，著书3部，获软件著作权6项。

sentences.english: Written cultural transmission was mainly writing books.
sentences.chinese: 书面文化的主要传播方式是著书立说。

definition: to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
to record sb's achievements in writing/to write a biography enhancing the subject's image
scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
